MSR.DESCRIPTION: Setting this enables data prefetching. Cache misses initiated by a memory read within a 32 byte cacheline are conditionally followed by cacheline fetches of the other line in the 64 byte sector
Global EWBE disable. When enabled, the processor does not attempt to enforce any write ordering internally or externally. This is the maximum performance setting.

Speculative EWBE disable. When enabled, the processor enforces strong ordering for all internal write cycles with the exception of write cycles addresed to a range of memory defined as uncacheable or write-combining by the MTRRs. This is the medium performance setting.

Strong ordering for all internal and external write cycles. In this setting the processor assumes that strong order must be maintained between writes to the merge buffer and writes that hit the processors cache. This is the lowest performance setting.
